description: From Middle French parental, from Latin parentalis, from parens (“parent”).

adjectives.description: parental (comparative more parental, superlative most parental)

entries.meaning: of or relating to a parent
(genetics) of the generation of organisms that produce a hybrid
examples: This, following Bateson, we may call the parental generation or P generation. Subsequent generations are called filial generations (abbreviated F) and their numerical order is indicated by a subscript, [...]

entries.meaning: A person fulfilling a parental role.
examples: Nowadays there are all kinds of potential parentals besides parents, grandparents, aunts and uncles, step-parents, in-laws, older siblings and cousins, and those in civil unions.
